intro: Cephaloschoenus longisetis, commonly known as the long-hair sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and swampy areas of eastern Australia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Cephaloschoenus longisetis thrives in waterlogged soils and plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems. Its presence is often an indicator of healthy, undisturbed wetland habitats.
